engineering_design_principles.description: Use of components for natural space debris removal
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Utilization of specific components that serve as important parts of the debris removal process, contributing to a cleaner orbital environment

engineering_design_principles.description: Data collection and analysis for scientific insights
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Collection and analysis of data from these components to provide valuable insights about the composition and properties of other celestial bodies such as comets and asteroids
Creation of components that can withstand the harsh conditions of space, such as high-speed motion, friction, and heat generation during entry into a planet's atmosphere
Study of various forces acting upon meteoroids in space, such as gravity and radiation pressure, to develop appropriate countermeasures and protective designs

engineering_design_principles.description: Material selection for durability and performance
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Choice of materials for the components, ensuring durability and optimal performance in the space environment, which are typically small, solid particles made up of rock, metal, or a combination of both
